cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles ENE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to pass over central and western Cuba, emerge into the Florida Straits, track northward just offshore the west coast of Florida and then accelerate northeastward along or just inland of the U.S. East Coast toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England by late Thursday into Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida (near the Big Bend/Tampa–Cedar Key area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watches confined to parts of the Florida Keys at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warnings in effect for Jamaica and portions of eastern and central Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Projected impact zone extends from Cuba and the Florida peninsula north-northeastward along the U.S. East Coast through the Carolinas, Mid-Atlantic and New England
weather_observation.wind: Low (≈3%) probability of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Thursday night into Friday; occasional gusts to gale force possible in squalls
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the Delaware River/upper Delaware Bay area
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible as the storm’s remnant passes, capable of brief urban or poor-drainage flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas on the approaches to Delaware Bay and possible short-period berth closures due to heavy rain or gusty squalls
